programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: At the foot of Xuelian Feng The team face a two-day walk to reach the base camp at 3,500 metres in altitude. The climbers are accompanied by half a dozen Uighur riders and 22 heavily laden horses. Upon arrival, the weather changes quickly and Xuelian Feng's peak disappears... Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Diois
We head for the Diois, in the company of Alain, to discover a world of colour and scent in his lavender fields. Céline collects pollen from her hives. A watery journey, through the Bouligons marshes and along the river Drôme. All about the Clairette de Die.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Natural attractions near Dijon A few kilometres from Dijon, between the river and the forest, lies a land boasting many resources: the Val-Suzon. Guillaume sets off to meet the fans of this conservation area where the forest is still a source of great emotion... And truffles! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: A visit behind the scenes of the Château de Versailles Royal Opera House, by the architect Ange-Jacques Gabriel. A new type of gallery-owner, Amélie du Chalard reinvents the profession, bringing art into the home, both hers and yours. Paris in the footsteps of General de Gaulle. Focus on French bagpipes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: Karen Swami has her feet firmly on the ground and both hands in the earth. An encounter with a ceramist unlike any other. The bronze medal may not be the most prestigious, but the metal used to make it is far more precious than you might think... Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc:
The Ambassadors take to song
Armelle begins her journey in the company of France Brel, a gentle voyage that also takes her to Brussels, and an encounter with Marie Warnant and Lubiana. We also catch up with Saul in Soignies, Aprile in Pays de Herve, BJ Scott in Verviers and Yousself Swatt's in Tournai...

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Mountain fever The first acclimatisation climb: Deadman's Peak at 5,400 metres. Despite the warnings from Roman Hari, the expedition's mountain doctor, the boys want to go too high, too quickly and soon discover the effects brought on by the altitude. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
Royan Atlantique
We set our heading for the Royan Atlantique where Sébastien fishes by eye and ear. Brice talks about his passion for salt. Focus on the white storks and other birds nesting in the region. All about the oyster huts of La Tremblade.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Does Chalon-sur-Saône have a good image? Does the place of birth of Nicéphore Niepce, who invented photography, have a good image? To find out, Guillaume sets off to discover this small mediaeval town, the birthplace of photography. Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Basilica of Saint Severinus, Bordeaux. Designer and plastic artist, Jules Levasseur stretches, transforms and cuts materials to give them a second life. We discover the traces Pablo Picasso left of his work in Paris. An immersion in the world of the mosaic artist Béatrice Serre. Presented by: Katherina Marx

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: In the heart of the 8th arrondissement of Paris, the Expiatory Chapel opens its doors and reveals its secrets. Then the chef David Toutain invites us to discover his restaurant, his kitchen and his career so far. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc:
The Ambassadors take to song
Armelle begins her journey in the company of France Brel, a gentle voyage that also takes her to Brussels, and an encounter with Marie Warnant and Lubiana. We also catch up with Saul in Soignies, Aprile in Pays de Herve, BJ Scott in Verviers and Yousself Swatt's in Tournai...

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Mountain fever The first acclimatisation climb: Deadman's Peak at 5,400 metres. Despite the warnings from Roman Hari, the expedition's mountain doctor, the boys want to go too high, too quickly and soon discover the effects brought on by the altitude. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 9:

Place Vendôme, spotlight on the jeweller Lorenz Bäumer. All there is to know about the kiss. Chausse Mouton has turned the traditional French carpet slipper into a modern accessory, whilst continuing to respect traditional French techniques. How to wear a sweater dress? Portrait of Roger Vincent, pipe carver in Saint-Claude.

Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Succulent !
programme.desc:
Rum baba
We rediscover this great classic desert: the rum baba. And even when prepared completely by the book, a little touch of fantasy is always possible, such as today's recipe, flavoured with rhubarb wine.
Presented by: Marie Montuir

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a floating island We head to Freedom Cove, a floating island built thirty years ago by Catherine and Wayne, a couple of artists. Impressed by the audacity of the project, Julien explores the challenges of life on the water, totally independent in terms of energy and food. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the French Senate, a building steeped in history. Ceramists from father to son, we meet François from the Jean Roger family. Three addresses for all fans of turntables and vinyl records. Focus on the chistera, the strange wicker glove emblematic of the Basque game of pelota. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Muffin recipes
Ricardo suggests a selection of muffin recipes for a filling snack easy to eat on the go: apricot muffins, sweetcorn muffins and pear, date and cream cheese muffins.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: In Paris for a rendezvous behind the scenes at the Sainte-Chapelle as we discover the hidden side of this religious monument. We then meet the young Swiss designer Eliane Heutschi, an up-and-coming talent in the world of fashion who mixes materials and techniques for her resolutely modern creations. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc:
The Ambassadors take to song

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc:
A visit to the Cognacq-Jay Museum, home to the 18th century artworks collected by Ernest Cognacq and Marie-Louise Jay. Interior designer Bruno Borrione advocates an uninhibited style using materials with character. Glenn Martens brings a fresh look to the Jean Paul Gaultier fashion house. All the expertise of Peruke.
Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Croustade aux pommes et aux courges
programme.desc: Apple and squash croustade Blake Mackay prepares a croustade that combines squash and apple to perfection. And to ensure nothing goes to waste, the apple skins and core are used to create home-made vinegar. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Bungalow Built to house families after the baby-boom, Quebec's bungalows are typical of the suburbs, each with their rectangular layout, basement and carport. Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: Experimenting, mixing and matching, collections of every possible description... An immersive visit to the fascinating world of Daniel Rozensztroch, artistic director. Being a man, or woman, of straw isn't always a bad thing. To convince you, an encounter with Célia Suzanne, specialist in straw marquetry. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Creemore, Ontario
Around fifty bats have taken up residence in an old house. Louis' mission is to gently move them out.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Moi j'mange
programme.desc:
Growing in my garden!
On the menu: Greek salad with tofu feta, melon and mint gazpacho, Korean-style grilled vegetables and chicken.
Presented by: Stéphane Bellavance. Directed by: Patrice Ouimet (season 2, Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Monte-Carlo Riviera
programme.desc:
Visit to a totally unique spot: the storage rooms of the Nouveau Musée National de Monaco (NMNM). Plus an immersion behind the scenes of the "Taming of the Shrew" by Les Ballets de Monte-Carlo.
Presented by: Cyril Viguier.
